CAPTION FIG1.png: 'Figure 1.: IL-1g release is dependent on Gasdermin-D in the presence and absence of cell lysis. (A-C)LDH release, PI staining and IL-1g release from Pam1CSK+;primed WT, Casp17-Casp17+ and Gsdmd+;BMDMs, infected with log-phase Salmonella enterica serovar Typhimurium (S. Typhimurium - MO1 10) for 60 min (A), transfected with poly(dA:dT) for 45 min (B) or treated with nigericin for 120 min (C), each condition in presence or absence of gel cyrine. Graphs show the mean and S.D. of four technical replicates per experiment, and are representative of 3 independent experiments. \\(P\\) < 0.05, **P** < 0.01, **“P** < 0.0001 and **“Ins”** no significance (unpaired t-test). (D) Western blot of supernatant and lysates of poly(dA:dT) treated BMDMs for 60 min. showing processing of pro-IL-1g and caspase-1 in presence or absence of glycine. Western blots are representative of 4 independent experiments. (E) BMDMs were infected with S. Typhimurium infection (MO1 10) to induce the MLRCA inflammasome and LDH release, PI influx and IL-1g release monitored over 240 min. Graphs show the mean and S.D. of four technical replicates per experiment, and are representative of 2 independent experiments.\n\n'

CAPTION FIG3.png: 'Figure 3: Release of small soluble cytosolic proteins via the GSDMD pore. (A) LDH, IL-Ib and IL-Ib release from Pam\\({}_{2}\\)CSK\\({}_{4}\\)-primed WT, Cesp17\\({}^{+}\\)/Cesp17\\({}^{+}\\) and Gsdmd\\({}^{+}\\) BMDMs transfected with poly(dA:dT) for 60 min in the presence or absence of glycine. Graph shows the mean and s.d. of three technical replicates per experiment and are representative of two independent experiments. "p \\(\\leq\\) 0.01, "np \\(\\leq\\) 0.001, "**p \\(\\leq\\) 0.0001, and "ns" no significance (unpaired t-test). (B) Immunohistochemistry for mature IL-Ib (p17), Rac-I, HMCB-I, mature caspase-1 (p10/p20) on supernatant and lysate fractions of either WT or Gsdmd\\({}^{+}\\) BMDMs transfected with poly(dA:dT) for 60 min. Tubulin was used as a loading control. Blots are representative of at least three independent experiments.\n\n'
